intro: Cyrtandra degenerans var. calycoschiza, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits. This species is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its unique adaptations to the island's ecosystem.
